title: Communications from Don Scott Ref. VMI

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records of all communications including, without limitation, text, phone call records (including list of phone numbers called and received and identification of the caller or person(s)/Offices calls received from), Instant messages, etc. including private communications devices and email used for this purpose) between House Speaker Don Scottor any of her staff and any member of and political group, media, the VMI Administration or the Board of Visitors and any member of the Virginia House or Senate, or their staff/representatives, on the subject of the VMI budget, Maj. Gen. Win's contract or employment, removal of Mr. Foster and Mr. Elliott from the VMI BOV, or any related issues specifically including the statements by Ms Foy or others to VMI BOV Members or any others regarding the potential or actual witholding or limiting VMI funding if the BOV does not take certain actions as addressed by Mr. Teddy Gottwald (a BOV Member) in the recent BOV meeting. These actions to include, without limitation, extending Maj. Gen. Wins' contact as stated in the February 18, 2025 letter from Congressman Ben Cline to the Clerks of the House and Senate. This includes any communications between Ms Foy, her staff, and/or Maj. Gen. Wins or any BOV Member and/or any member of the VMI Faculty or staff or member of the public without limitation for the past 120 days.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

title: FAFSA Updates

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FAFSA Updates
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records related to the "2026-2027 Free Application for Federal Student Aid" update, including records sent to the Office of Management and Budget, inclusive of (but not necessarily limited to) OMB control number 1845-0001, Department of Education docket ED-2025-SCC-0011, and Federal Register doc 2025-02191.

The Department of Education has announced broad changes to the FAFSA (https://www.ed.gov/about/news/press-release/us-department-of-education-announces-improvements-fafsar-form) but has not provided the public with the exact proposed changes. While it is my understanding the Paperwork Reduction Act does not necessarily require publishing changes sought from OMB, it is difficult, if not impossible, to making meaningful public comments to OMB about the proposed changes.

The Department of Education claims the proposed changes will decrease the public burden by OVER TWO MILLION HOURS. This is a substantial change. Therefore, I am requesting a fee waiver, as the Department of Education press release states, but does not specify, vague policy changes. It is in the public interest to understand these policy changes, how it may impact public burden under the Paperwork Reduction Act, and how other organizations who rely on the FAFSA, including state universities, will be affected by these changes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Karl Koscher

title: Records related to the email address supersat@cs.washington.edu

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records related to the email address supersat@cs.washington.edu
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all emails, documents, or other records about, or sent to, supersat@cs.washington.edu.

Personal and Washington State government records suggest that the supersat@cs.washington.edu email address was included in the Department of Homeland Security's internal "address book." Several emails, including one with sensitive PII, were sent to this address over the course of about a year and a half. Please redact FOIA-exempt PII in the records provided.

I am seeking to understand how this email address was added to DHS's "address book" and how it lead to CBP/DHS inadvertently leaking sensitive PII to a state government email address with less exemptions than FOIA. I am making this request in the public interest to understand how CBP/DHS policy led to this issue, how CBP/DHS responded, any lessons CBP/DHS learned, and how Americans may protect themselves.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Karl Koscher

title: IRS Direct File Source Code and Related Records (U.S. Office of Management and Budget)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IRS Direct File Source Code and Related Records (U.S. Office of Management and Budget)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all non-exempt source code for the Internal Revenue Service's Direct File program, as well as direct supporting documentation, including design documents, product requirement documents, bug/issue tracking tickets, and other documents reasonably similar in description.

It is my understanding that this code was developed by US Government employees and thus ineligible for domestic copyright protection under 17 U.S.C. § 105, as well as exempt from any trade secret exemptions of the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552) or any Federal Acquisition Regulations.

Certain source code containing password, encryption keys, credentials, and the like are not requested. Code directly involved in any anti-fraud measures is also not requested. However, if sensitive, non-responsive code/documents is intermixed with responsive code/documents (e.g., in the same file), I am requesting the non-responsive code/documents be redacted. If redaction will delay response, I am requesting non-redacted responsive code/documents (e.g., files or documents which do not contain any sensitive information) to be disclosed as soon as possible.  

This request is directed to the Internal Revenue Service directly as well as the US Office of Management and Budget, which, according to published IRS documents (e.g., https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-pdf/p5788.pdf), worked with IRS through its USDS division to develop the system. To ease the burden of this request, I encourage IRS and USDS/OMB to work together to de-duplicate responsive records, to the extent that any coordination would not delay substantially delay the disclosure of responsive records.

In the wake of news that the IRS Direct File program may be discontinued, I am requesting these records to release to public such that a competitive, free, and open-source alternative may be provided. Accordingly, I am requesting a fee waiver, as the IRS's own report (https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-pdf/p5788.pdf) supports a free, non-commercial way to prepare tax returns, and is in the public interest. Any disclosed records will not be used for commercial advantage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Karl Koscher

title: OPM FOIA Org Chart

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OPM FOIA Org Chart
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The current org chart for OPM’s FOIA Office, reflecting vacancies as of February 18, 2025.

2. The org chart for OPM’s FOIA Office on January 18, 2025, reflecting any vacancies on that date. 

Request for Expedited Processing

I hereby request expedited processing of this request. CNN reported all employees of OPM FOIA were terminated on or around February 17, 2025. If true, this would render the office unable to meet its statutory obligations, potentially violating the Anti-Deficiency Act, and thus, raising issues as to whether the President’s team is in violation of the Constitution’s Take Care clause.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: FOIA Request: SEPTA M5 Rail Car Procurement [RFP 23-0085-AJAC]

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: FOIA Request: SEPTA M5 Rail Car Procurement [RFP 23-0085-AJAC]
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

This pertains specifically to the Southeastern Pennsylvania Transportation Authority Procurement for new railcars in July 2023 (RFP 23-0085-AJAC for M5 Metro Rail Cars):

Complete Submissions from Competitors: This includes all proposals, bids, and submissions from competing firms, detailing pricing, technical specifications, project timelines, and any other relevant information provided during the procurement process.

Evaluation Documents: Any documents related to the evaluation of the submissions, including scoring sheets, evaluation criteria, and notes from evaluators.

Communications: All communications between the Omaha Streetcar Authority and the competing firms, including emails, letters, meeting minutes, and any other forms of correspondence.

Contracts and Agreements: Copies of any contracts, agreements, or memorandums of understanding signed with the selected firm.

Meeting Minutes and Reports: Minutes from meetings where the procurement was discussed, as well as any reports or presentations related to the procurement process.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: Fwd: Freedom of Information Act Request: Sonny Carter Navy Files
communications.communication:
Dear Andrew Free:

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to
the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) via email to
foia@nara.gov. We received your request on February 18, 2025.  Your request
states:

*The Navy personnel file (service jacket) for Manley Lanier "Sonny" Carter,
Jr., M.D., who died in a plane crash in April 1994:
https://www.nasa.gov/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/167748main_fs_nbl508c.pdf?emrc=67e772
<https://www.nasa.gov/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/167748main_fs_nbl508c.pdf?emrc=67e772>.*

Due to the nature of your inquiry, we are forwarding your request by this
email to the National Personnel Records Center (NPRC) for Military Records
in St. Louis for appropriate handling.  The NPRC will assign your request a
tracking number and respond directly to you.  In the future, if you need to
contact the NPRC, you can do so by mail or fax to the following address:

National Personnel Records Center
1 Archives Drive
St. Louis, Missouri 63138

Telephone:   314-801-0800
Telephone (Toll Free):  1-866-272-6272 (only within the US)
Fax:  314-801-9195

For your reference, below you will find your original submission.

On our website at https://www.archives.gov/veterans/military-service-records
you can find information about requesting Official Military Personnel Files
(OMPFs) that are not yet archival records fully open to the public.  At the
website for the National Archives at St. Louis,
https://www.archives.gov/st-louis/ <https://www.archives.gov/st-louis/%20>,
you will find information about requesting Official Military Personnel
Files that are now archival records open to the public.  The OMPF normally

title: Enforcement Data: Tennessee Lawful Employment Act (HB 1378)

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Enforcement Data: Tennessee Lawful Employment Act (HB 1378)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dates: 2011 - present (broken out by year).

- Total number of tips or complaints received related to employer noncompliance with E-Verify mandates. 

- Total number of investigations and/or audits conducted on employers for E-Verify compliance. 

- Total number of warnings issued to employers for E-Verify noncompliance. 

- Total number of civil fines issued for E-Verify noncompliance. 

- Total dollar amount of civil fines collected in the "lawful employment enforcement fund."

- Total number of cases prosecuted against employers for E-Verify noncompliance. 

If a particular metric is not available/applicable, please proceed with the available data (or the most similar metric).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Michael Macher.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Enforcement Data: Tennessee Lawful Employment Act (HB 1378)
communications.communication:
Mr. Hoover,

§T.C.A. 10-7-503(a)(2)(A) makes public records available to citizens of the state of Tennessee. The same act permits the records custodian to require photo identification, issued by a governmental entity that includes the person's address. This enables the record custodian to confirm the requestor's status as a citizen of Tennessee.
Please submit a photo of a valid State of Tennessee identification so the agency can proceed with preparing the estimated cost to fulfill your request.
Best regards,

[cid:image001.png@01DB81FB.891A05C0]
Chris Cannon | Chief Communications Officer
Assistant Commissioner, Communications and Events Division
220 French Landing Drive – 4A
Nashville, TN 37243
615-253-4251

Sincerely, 

Mahad Mohammed

title: Sunshine Law Request: Clearview AI

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Sunshine Law Request: Clearview AI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

- All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with Clearview AI, Inc. that were active any time between 1/1/2023 and the date this request is fulfilled.
- All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to Clearview AI, Inc. Responsive materials include all invoices, bills, receipts, check stubs, or any other records, including those possessed in an electronic format.
- A copy of all training materials, including but not limited to any handouts, workbooks, assessments, presentations, slides, videos, audio files, or other materials, either developed in-house or provided to the agency pertaining to the agency's use of Clearview AI, Inc. products.
- A copy of all agency manuals either developed in-house or provided to the agency pertaining to the agency's use of Clearview AI, Inc. products.
- A copy of all agency policies and procedures either developed in-house or provided to the agency pertaining to the agency's use of Clearview AI, Inc. products.
- A roster of all agency employees who either had or currently have a user account for Clearview AI, Inc. products or had or currently have internal agency permissions to use Clearview AI, Inc. products any time between 7/1/2024 and the date this request is fulfilled.
- A roster of all agency employees who have completed agency training for the use of Clearview AI, Inc. products any time between 7/1/2024 and the date this request is fulfilled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

e

title: July 17, 2022 Greenwood Park Mall Shooting Request (Department of Homeland Security)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: July 17, 2022 Greenwood Park Mall Shooting Request (Department of Homeland Security)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

•Bodycam Footage in the mall and of the search at the suspect’s residence
•Crime scene photos
•Contents at the suspect’s residence 
•Photos of the interior of the suspect’s residence 
•Witness statements
•CCTV footage at the mall
•Contents of the Suspect’s phone
•Photos of the suspect’s social media
•Any photos of the suspect that haven’t been released, even photos years prior to the shooting 


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

If you regard any of the requested records as subject to exemption from required disclosure under the law, I hereby request that you exercise your discretion and disclose them nonetheless.

If you decide to withhold any requested records, please do not deny the entire request and release information available under the law. If you cannot fulfil certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after reducing or removing these portions claimed to be exempt. I ask you to explain why the portion had to be redacted and what was redacted.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. 

Sincerely,

James Ferguson

communications.subject: Your Request to Palm Beach Gardens Police Department
communications.communication:
Good morning, 
  
 Your request for body camera video has been received on the above-referenced case. This case is a DUI with a crash involved. Please review the current Florida State Chapter 119 Public Records Laws in reference to crash report information: 
  
 “As a condition precedent to accessing a crash report, a person must present a valid driver’s license or other photographic identification, proof of status or identification that demonstrates his or her qualifications to access that information, and file a written sworn statement with the state or local agency in possession of the information stating that information from a crash report made confidential and exempt by this section will not be used for any commercial solicitation of accident victims, or knowingly disclosed to any third party for the purpose of such solicitation.” Section 316.066(2)(d), F.S. 
  
 If you qualify under the Florida Statute to have access to the crash information, the estimated cost for the footage is $188.86. Please complete, notarize, and return the form if applicable so I can begin processing your request. Unless a notarized crash affidavit indicating a legitimate reason to your involvement in this case is provided, this case will be closed. 
  
 HSMV Form 94010 Sworn Statement for Crash Report 
  
 Thank you, 
  
 Kelsey Olsowski
Digital Evidence Technician
Palm Beach Gardens Police Dept.
10500 N. Military Trail
Palm Beach Gardens FL 33410

title: Mitchell OSI Investigation (Department Of Corrections And Community Supervision New York State)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Mitchell OSI Investigation (Department Of Corrections And Community Supervision New York State)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The Department of Corrections and Community Supervision Office of Special Investigations investigation into a January 23, 2015 complaint by DOCCS employee Joyce Mitchell. The complaint was referred to DOCCS OSI by Clinton Correctional Facility administration on February 3, 2015.

The OSI investigation was part of the State of New York Office of the Inspector General's investigation of the June 5, 2015 escape of David Sweat and Richard Matt from Clinton Correctional Facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi
